company1.name: Telus Communications
highlights: Developed code for adaptation algorithms for a python-based streaming player in a Docker environment.
Led the integration of Reinforcement Learning (RL) algorithms to dynamically select parameters for adaptations. Reduced stall duration by up to 56%, under different testing environments.
Contributed to the development of custom testbed with Javascript-based streaming player (Shaka) utilizing puppeteer in Docker. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to enhance performance.
Streamlined CI pipelines by improving workflows with GitHub Actions and implementing unit tests using Pytest.

company2.name: University of Calgary
highlights: Worked in Waves Lab on a novel frame size prediction integrating machine learning (ML) algorithms using scikit-learn and TensorFlow to enable network resource allocation in cloud server.
Achieved a 54% improvement in Quality of Service (QoS) by using transfer learning techniques for a new user network traffic prediction. Presented this work at an international conference.

Developed a compression technique for 8K virtual reality frames using generative model (VAE-GAN) in pyTorch, achieving 45.1% improvement while maintaining compatibility with existing video infrastructure.
Carried out experiments, trained models, documented results to suggest optimal algorithms and configurations.

company3.name: University of Calgary
highlights: Designed SQL queries to extract data from large-scale network traffic data on MySQL database.
Conducted exploratory data analysis (EDA) on frame-level data of network using Python (pandas, NumPy).
Created Tableau dashboards integrating MySQL to visualize real-time VR performance metrics.
Managed two junior team members on corresponding research projects involving channel prediction for BCI.
